subhead: Flying the flag for environmental action, as he did at the United Nations Ocean Conference in Nice, the French president has grown frustrated as his legacy is picked apart by the right and far right, as well as some of his own supporters.

title: Brian Wilson, one of pop music's great visionaries, has died
Harvey Weinstein found guilty of sexual assault in New York
Gavin Newsom delivers scathing criticism of Trump: 'Democracy is under assault right before our eyes'
subhead: As the mayor of Los Angeles imposed a curfew after several days of protests against federal immigration policy, the Democratic governor addressed Californians in a statesmanlike tone.

title: Colombia gripped by waves of violence
subhead: A series of attacks has plunged two southwestern regions of the country into mourning, leaving at least eight dead on Wednesday. No group has claimed responsibility, but authorities suspect the armed group Estado Mayor Central.

title: Trump touts 'done' deal with Beijing on rare earths, Chinese students
subhead: Donald Trump said on Wednesday that the US and China had agreed on a deal to preserve a trade war truce, with Beijing to supply rare earth minerals, and the US to allow Chinese students to attend its colleges.

title: The life and death of Julie, 21, swept up in the spiral of social media
subhead: Julie Pospieszny's tragic fate was that of a young woman of her generation, born into the age of social media and a victim of the violence it can unleash. Caught in the spiral of easy money and addicted to laughing gas, the influencer died in March. She was 21 years old.

title: Starmer condemns second night of rioting in Northern Ireland town

'Monacogate': Prince Albert II's former trusted adviser tells police everything
subhead: Claude Palmero, a former administrator of the principality's assets who was dismissed in spring 2023 and is now under investigation, has made a series of revelations about the princely family.

title: In Ukraine, the high stakes of documenting the war
subhead: Since Russia's invasion of Ukraine, hundreds of projects have been launched to record the conflict, as well as Ukraine's history and heritage. Many of these initiatives focus on documenting war crimes committed by the Russian army, to be used as evidence in legal proceedings.

title: Will Macronism outlive Macron?
subhead: Government spokesperson Sophie Primas inadvertently sparked a debate about the legacy of the French president when she referred to the 'end of Macronism' at the end of May.
